means: 使恶心，作呕( nauseate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She could not eat anything without feeling nauseated.
I was nauseated by the violence in the movie.
sentence.Network_cn: 影片中的暴力场面让我感到恶心。

sentence.Network_en: But I have chewed it all well and I am not nauseated.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而我把它全细细咀嚼后吃下去了,没有恶心作呕.

entry.def: If something nauseates you, it makes you feel as if you are going to vomit.

example.ex: The smell of frying nauseated her...
She could not eat anything without feeling nauseated.

means.word_mean: 1. feeling nausea; feeling about to vomit

auth_sentence.content: But she complained that constipation was making her nauseated and uncomfortable.
auth_sentence.res_content: But she complained that constipation was making her nauseated and uncomfortable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But she complained that constipation was making her nauseated and uncomfortable.

auth_sentence.content: Only one thing nauseated him as much as the modern bathing suit.

auth_sentence.content: The man is beginning to feel nauseated, thinking about it all.
